1/* $NetBSD: md.h,v 1.2 2019/01/09 16:55:15 christos Exp $ */

14/*!
15 * \file isc/md.h
16 * \brief This is the header file for message digest algorithms.
17 */
18
19#pragma once
20
21#include <isc/lang.h>
22#include <isc/platform.h>
23#include <isc/types.h>
24#include <isc/result.h>
25
26#include <openssl/evp.h>
27
28typedef EVP_MD_CTX isc_md_t;
29
30/**
31 * isc_md_type_t:
32 * @ISC_MD_MD5: MD5
33 * @ISC_MD_SHA1: SHA-1
34 * @ISC_MD_SHA224: SHA-224
35 * @ISC_MD_SHA256: SHA-256
36 * @ISC_MD_SHA384: SHA-384
37 * @ISC_MD_SHA512: SHA-512
38 *
39 * Enumeration of supported message digest algorithms.
40 */
41typedef const EVP_MD * isc_md_type_t;
42
43#define ISC_MD_MD5 EVP_md5()
44#define ISC_MD_SHA1 EVP_sha1()
45#define ISC_MD_SHA224 EVP_sha224()
46#define ISC_MD_SHA256 EVP_sha256()
47#define ISC_MD_SHA384 EVP_sha384()
48#define ISC_MD_SHA512 EVP_sha512()
49
50#define ISC_MD5_DIGESTLENGTH isc_md_type_get_size(ISC_MD_MD5)
51#define ISC_MD5_BLOCK_LENGTH isc_md_type_get_block_size(ISC_MD_MD5)
52#define ISC_SHA1_DIGESTLENGTH isc_md_type_get_size(ISC_MD_SHA1)
53#define ISC_SHA1_BLOCK_LENGTH isc_md_type_get_block_size(ISC_MD_SHA1)
54#define ISC_SHA224_DIGESTLENGTH isc_md_type_get_size(ISC_MD_SHA224)
55#define ISC_SHA224_BLOCK_LENGTH isc_md_type_get_block_size(ISC_MD_SHA224)
56#define ISC_SHA256_DIGESTLENGTH isc_md_type_get_size(ISC_MD_SHA256)
57#define ISC_SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH isc_md_type_get_block_size(ISC_MD_SHA256)
58#define ISC_SHA384_DIGESTLENGTH isc_md_type_get_size(ISC_MD_SHA384)
59#define ISC_SHA384_BLOCK_LENGTH isc_md_type_get_block_size(ISC_MD_SHA384)
60#define ISC_SHA512_DIGESTLENGTH isc_md_type_get_size(ISC_MD_SHA512)
61#define ISC_SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH isc_md_type_get_block_size(ISC_MD_SHA512)
62
63#define ISC_MAX_MD_SIZE EVP_MAX_MD_SIZE
64#define ISC_MAX_BLOCK_SIZE 128U /* ISC_SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH */
65
66/**
67 * isc_md:
68 * @type: the digest type
69 * @buf: the data to hash
70 * @len: the length of the data to hash
71 * @digest: the output buffer
72 * @digestlen: the length of the data written to @digest
73 *
74 * This function hashes @len bytes of data at @buf and places the result in
75 * @digest. If the @digestlen parameter is not NULL then the number of bytes of
76 * data written (i.e. the length of the digest) will be written to the integer
77 * at @digestlen, at most ISC_MAX_MD_SIZE bytes will be written.
78 */
79isc_result_t
80isc_md(isc_md_type_t type, const unsigned char *buf, const size_t len,
81 unsigned char *digest, unsigned int *digestlen);
82
83/**
84 * isc_md_new:
85 *
86 * This function allocates, initializes and returns a digest context.
87 */
88isc_md_t *
89isc_md_new(void);
90
91/**
92 * isc_md_free:
93 * @md: message digest context
94 *
95 * This function cleans up digest context ctx and frees up the space allocated
96 * to it.
97 */
98void
99isc_md_free(isc_md_t *);
100
101/**
102 * isc_md_init:
103 * @md: message digest context
104 * @type: digest type
105 *
106 * This function sets up digest context @md to use a digest @type. @md must be
107 * initialized before calling this function.
108 */
109isc_result_t
110isc_md_init(isc_md_t *, const isc_md_type_t md_type);
111
112/**
113 * isc_md_reset:
114 * @md: message digest context
115 *
116 * This function resets the digest context ctx. This can be used to reuse an
117 * already existing context.
118 */
119isc_result_t
120isc_md_reset(isc_md_t *md);
121
122/**
123 * isc_md_update:
124 * @md: message digest context
125 * @buf: data to hash
126 * @len: length of the data to hash
127 *
128 * This function hashes @len bytes of data at @buf into the digest context @md.
129 * This function can be called several times on the same @md to hash additional
130 * data.
131 */
132isc_result_t
133isc_md_update(isc_md_t *md, const unsigned char *buf, const size_t len);
134
135/**
136 * isc_md_final:
137 * @md: message digest context
138 * @digest: the output buffer
139 * @digestlen: the length of the data written to @digest
140 *
141 * This function retrieves the digest value from @md and places it in @digest.
142 * If the @digestlen parameter is not NULL then the number of bytes of data
143 * written (i.e. the length of the digest) will be written to the integer at
144 * @digestlen, at most ISC_MAX_MD_SIZE bytes will be written. After calling
145 * this function no additional calls to isc_md_update() can be made.
146 */
147isc_result_t
148isc_md_final(isc_md_t *md, unsigned char *digest, unsigned int *digestlen);
149
150/**
151 * isc_md_get_type:
152 * @md: message digest contezt
153 *
154 * This function return the isc_md_type_t previously set for the supplied
155 * message digest context or NULL if no isc_md_type_t has been set.
156 */
157isc_md_type_t
158isc_md_get_md_type(isc_md_t *md);
159
160/**
161 * isc_md_size:
162 *
163 * This function return the size of the message digest when passed an isc_md_t
164 * structure, i.e. the size of the hash.
165 */
166size_t
167isc_md_get_size(isc_md_t *md);
168
169/**
170 * isc_md_block_size:
171 *
172 * This function return the block size of the message digest when passed an
173 * isc_md_t structure.
174 */
175size_t
176isc_md_get_block_size(isc_md_t *md);
177
178/**
179 * isc_md_size:
180 *
181 * This function return the size of the message digest when passed an
182 * isc_md_type_t , i.e. the size of the hash.
183 */
184size_t
185isc_md_type_get_size(isc_md_type_t md_type);
186
187/**
188 * isc_md_block_size:
189 *
190 * This function return the block size of the message digest when passed an
191 * isc_md_type_t.
192 */
193size_t
194isc_md_type_get_block_size(isc_md_type_t md_type);
195
